component.text:
Activity – Part 1: Identify IPsec Encryption Algorithms
Drag the classification (Symmetric or Asymmetric) to the appropriate encryption term or concept. Click Button 2 to continue this activity.
You have successfully classified each IPsec encryption term and concept. Please click Button 2 to continue.
You have not successfully classified each IPsec encryption term and concept. Please click Reset to try again.
Uses private and public key encryption/decryption.
Encryption and decryption processes use the same key.
Uses digital certificates and key management.
Encryption and decryption processes use different keys.

Activity – Part 2: Identify the Authentication Steps
Drag the IPsec authentication procedure steps into the correct order to show the data integrity and authentication process. Click Button 3 to continue this activity.
The recipient deconstructs the message and the received hash.
The sender generates a hash of the message and sends it with the message.
If the hashes match, the message is considered authenticated.
The recipient creates a hash from the received message and compares it to the original hash.
You have successfully ordered the steps to show the IPsec data integrity and authentication process. Please click Button 3 to continue.
You have not successfully ordered the steps to show the IPsec data integrity and authentication process. Please click Reset to try again.

Activity – Part 3: Identify Data Integrity and Authentication Terminology
Match each data integrity and authentication term to its description. Click Button 4 to continue this activity.
You have successfully matched each data integrity and authentication term to its description. Please click Button 4 to continue.
You have not successfully matched each data integrity and authentication term to its description. Please click Reset to try again.
A pre-set, shared secret key for use over symmetric VPN channels.
A standard key-exchange method used for secure, authenticated VPN communications over the Internet.
HMAC algorithm which uses a 160-bit secret key for authentication of transmitted data.
A digital certificate exchange process used to authenticate users with each other while using VPNs.
HMAC algorithm which uses a 128-bit shared secret key for the authentication of transmitted data.

Activity – Part 4: Identify IPsec Security Options
Identify each IPsec option as a secure or insecure IPsec protocol setting.
You have successfully identified the IPsec security options.
You have not successfully identified the IPsec security options. Please click Reset to try again.
